TopicTitle: Posting pictures (not the same as before)

Articles.Content: Suggestion: have moderators review posts with pictures before they are actually added. I'm saying this because I've seen pictures that -let's just say- wouldn't have gotten past if the profanity filter applied to pictures.

If you see such a post, please use the Report Post function. As soon as that report goes though (yeah, there's a bug where it doesn't give you confirmation for AGES if at all, but it does go through practically instantly), every moderator on the forum receives an email. For those like myself, we see that email instantly (I get notifications for new email within a minute or two via Google Chrome, and/or my mobile device). Profanity in any form is not permitted, and using pictures to circumvent the restriction is just as bad as plain text slurs or swears.

It would solve the issue to have all posts containing pictures be reviewed by moderators, but there would simply be far too many of them, I think, and people would start to simply find ways around them because we can't be on the forums 24/7 approving every tenth post that's made. The forum has around 5000 active users, after all...
